comments:
I just created a new query on bug.eclipse.org/bugs that returned about 100 hits.  I was manually opening each one by clicking on the task in the Mylar task list, and after I had opened approximately 50 of them (each in a new editor) Eclipse crashed on me with the SWTError stack trace in the console of the launching workspace.  

I was able to reproduce this crash by restarting Eclipse and opening many Bugzilla tasks sequentially.  When I reproduced it, I found an "Application error" that was similar but not exactly the same as the first stack trace followed by many "Widget disposed too early" messages in the error log of the launching workspace (below the 'SWTError: No more handles' stack trace).  When I reproduced the error, I had about 100 editors open (4 I can see, and a little arrow with 99+) about 80 were open when I restarted Eclipse and I opened about 20 more to reproduce the error.


'SWTError: No more handles' stack trace

Meghan: if you do reproduce again with the next dev build please reopen the bug.
